column4: how come my harddrives shuffle names within /dev/ from time to time?
from like sda to sdb and visa versa for some reason...
seems to be order of detection on the controller.
there anything i can do to prevent this?
not that i have figured out.
both of the drives are on the same chipset
its soo strange because it used to work fine in older versions of ubuntu
if your drives are on the same controller then im not sure why... i thought it was just an issue with multiple controllers
this is why im soo confused just randomly they re assign and i have to constantly re edit my fstab and remount
report it.
the way to work around it is to mount with the UUIDs
ahh yes uuids i dont know why i didnt think about that...
whats the command to echo the uuids of my connected drives again?
ls -als /dev/disk/by-uuid/
where should i report this to in the mean time?
not sure if it can be considered a bug..., but https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs
righteo thanks lots
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux-meta/+bug/119233
thanks for looking that up for me ill look into it briefly
